jp.go.aist.dggs

Class MortonUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • jp.go.aist.dggs.MortonUtils

  • public class MortonUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Handling PD code (one of type of Morton code) for 3-dimensional coordinates (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979) reference: Sirdeshmukh, Neeraj, et al. "Utilizing a discrete global grid system for handling point clouds with varying locations, times, and levels of detail." Cartographica: The International Journal for Geographic Information and Geovisualization 54.1 (2019): 4-15.
    Author:
    TaehoonKim AIST DPRT, Research Assistant

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MortonUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate convertFromMorton(java.lang.String pdCode)
      PD code (Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud) decoding to 3-dimensional coordinates (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979) Target resolution is MAX_RESOLUTION (=32)
      static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate convertFromMorton(java.lang.String pdCode, int resolution)
      PD code (Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud) decoding to 3-dimensional coordinates (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979)
      static java.lang.String convertToMorton(double latitude, double longitude, double height, int resolution)
      PD code (Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud) encoding from 3-dimensional coordinates (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979)
      static java.lang.String getGreatestCommonAncestor(java.lang.String[] pdCodes)
      Searching a greatest common ancestor from given PD code list PD code is one of type of Morton code, especially DGGS Morton for the point cloud DGGS is discrete global grid system

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getGreatestCommonAncestor

        public static java.lang.String getGreatestCommonAncestor(java.lang.String[] pdCodes)
        Searching a greatest common ancestor from given PD code list PD code is one of type of Morton code, especially DGGS Morton for the point cloud DGGS is discrete global grid system
        Parameters:
        pdCodes - List of PD code
        Returns:
        A greatest common ancestor of PD codes

      • convertToMorton

        public static java.lang.String convertToMorton(double latitude,
                                               double longitude,
                                               double height,
                                               int resolution)
        PD code (Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud) encoding from 3-dimensional coordinates (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979)
        Parameters:
        latitude - latitude from WGS84 (UoM: degree)
        longitude - longitude from WGS84 (UoM: degree)
        height - ellipsoidal height (UoM: meter)
        resolution - Resolution of generate PD code
        Returns:
        PD code (Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud)

      • convertFromMorton

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate convertFromMorton(java.lang.String pdCode,
                                                                     int resolution)
        PD code (Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud) decoding to 3-dimensional coordinates (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979)
        Parameters:
        pdCode - Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud, except rhombus face number
        resolution - Target resolution of PD code
        Returns:
        3-dimensional coordinate (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979), form as Coordinate[x=latitude,y=longitude,z=height]

      • convertFromMorton

        public static org.locationtech.jts.geom.Coordinate convertFromMorton(java.lang.String pdCode)
        PD code (Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud) decoding to 3-dimensional coordinates (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979) Target resolution is MAX_RESOLUTION (=32)
        Parameters:
        pdCode - Point cloud DGGS code, DGGS Morton for point cloud, except rhombus face number
        Returns:
        3-dimensional coordinate (WGS 84 3D, EPSG 4979), form as Coordinate[x=latitude,y=longitude,z=height]
